If an HSR undertakes a special HSR training course, then they also have the power to:

 

Click the buttons below for more information

 

 

This may occur if the representative reasonably believes that the work will expose the worker to a serious health or safety risk arising from an immediate or imminent exposure to a hazard. (This does not apply to Western Australia and Queensland.)

 

 

This may occur if the HSR reasonably believes that a person is breaching the WHS Act (or has done so and is likely to do so again), or equivalent laws. The PIN must specify the breach and may instruct the person how to prevent it from happening again. An HSR cannot issue a PIN unless the HSR has first consulted with the person.
